page.title: 09THE PEAK FOREST CANAL
page.content: The Peak Forest Canal starts at Buxworth and Whaley Bridge basin.It used to link up to a tramway from Doveholes which carried lime from quarries and the Cromford and High Peak Railway. Today it is used for pleasure - walking , canoeing , some people put their model boats in the cool waters,and now theres even a holiday firm.There are marinas at Newtown, Furness Vale and Whaley Bridge.The canal then joins onto the national network.By Shane Winch My uncle works on the canal with a crane which pulls all the muck and old bikes out of the water.Once my uncle fell in the canal and managed to get out by climbing the chain from his crane.By Jason Warhurst.
